DOC.brief_summary: This two arm randomize , pair prospective study compare percentage time spend Contact Force ( CF ) , Force Time Integral ( FTI ) lesion parameter set pace versus non-pacing . This study design compare percentage time spend CF 10 gram pace non-paced lesion 15 pre-determined lesion location .
DOC.brief_title: The Physiological Effects Pacing Catheter Ablation Procedures Treat Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomize proceed one two study arm : 1 . Pacing first half lesion : During 15 pre-specified lesion , pace initiated 500ms cycle length catheter coronary sinus right ventricle prior start lesion . Pacing stop halfway point ( e.g . 10 second 20-second lesion 15 second 30-second lesion ) . In event Wenckebach behavior note , pace adjust 550ms cycle length . In event Wenckebach behavior persists , cycle length adjust 600ms . In event Weckebach behavior continue , pace catheter move right ventricle , pace perform 500ms cycle length . If Wenckebach behavior still persist , patient withdrawn study . 2 . Pacing second half lesion : During 15 pre-specified lesion , pace stop halfway point ( e.g . 10 second 20-second lesion 15 second 30-second lesion ) . In event Wenckebach behavior note , pace adjust 550ms cycle length . In event Wenckebach behavior persists , cycle length adjust 600ms . In event Wenckebach behavior persists , pace catheter move right ventricle pace perform 500ms cycle length . If Wenckebach behavior still persist , patient withdrawn study .
DOC.criteria: Patients AF schedule AF ablation plan pulmonary vein isolation Presenting normal sinus rhythm ( NSR ) prior lesion delivery Previous radiofrequency ablation Previous thoracotomytype AF ablation ( MAZE similar technique ) In AF prior lesion delivery Evidence leave atrial scarring voltage map Resting heart rate > 90 bpm
